page.title: 04CLIMATE IN THE SEISDON AREA
page.content: The climate of this district is quite normal for the west midlands of England, rarely going to any extremes. Frost and snow do regularly occur in winter, the latter tending to drift easily because of the flat ground and the strong winds which often sweep across the area, encouraged no doubt by the lie of the land. The main road is kept clear of snow but it can be a problem sometimes in the narrow lanes. Rainfall is not very high, though probably average for this part of the country. In drier summers some farmers irrigate their crops continuously.
